DESCRIPTION: Total number of rice grains detected in the image.
Number of grains classified as broken (typically below a length threshold relative to whole grains).
Number of grains classified as long based on length criteria defined by the lab system.
Number of grains classified as medium-length.
Number of grains with black or dark discoloration, often associated with damage or spoilage.
Number of grains exhibiting chalkiness (opaque or white areas), a common quality defect affecting milling yield. This is only for white rice samples.
Number of grains with red pigmentation, often linked to varietal traits or incomplete milling.
Number of grains showing yellow discoloration, potentially due to ageing, moisture, or processing issues.
Number of immature grains with green coloration.
Average length of whole rice kernels (typically measured in millimetres).
Average width of whole rice kernels.
Average length-to-width ratio of whole kernels, commonly used to describe grain shape (e.g. slender vs bold).
Average lightness value (L*), where higher values indicate brighter grains.
Average a* value, representing the red–green axis (positive = red, negative = green).
Average b* value, representing the yellow–blue axis (positive = yellow, negative = blue).
